alert.note: Alert for Ferry (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 20 at 12:12AM PDT until May 24 at 1:41PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Spokane WA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Washington... Kettle River near Ferry above Curlew affecting Ferry County. For the Kettle River...including Ferry above Curlew...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO EARLY WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast to continue through Saturday morning. It will then likely fall below flood stage through most of the weekend, before possibly rising above flood stage again early next week. * WHERE...Kettle River near Ferry above Curlew. * WHEN...From early this morning to early Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, Flooding at Beal Park on West Kettle River Road, west of Curlew. `Ol Swimming Hole Park in Curlew will be inundated. Flooding of yards and outbuildings along the river from the Canadian border through Curlew on both sides of the river. Some driveways on Kettle River Road will be flooded. Water will be over Customs Road near Riverview Lane and between milepost 5 and 6. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:15 PM PDT Friday the stage was 18.5 feet. - Bankfull stage is 17.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:15 PM PDT Friday was 18.5 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate near flood stage with a maximum value of 19.0 feet Tuesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 18.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.7 feet on 05/20/2008. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 515 PM PDT.
